text:
Running the example ﬁrst prints the contrived time series dataset. Next, the model
conﬁgurations and their errors are reported as they are evaluated. Finally, the conﬁgurations
and the error for the top three conﬁgurations are reported. We can see that the persistence
model with a conﬁguration of 1 (e.g. persist the last observation) achieves the best performance
of the simple models tested, as would be expected.
[10.0, 20.0, 30.0, 40.0, 50.0, 60.0, 70.0, 80.0, 90.0, 100.0]
...
